title: How to Download an Older Version of Netflix: Android Guide

steps.title: Uninstall
steps.content: Uninstall the Netflix app you have from your Android. Tap and hold the app icon (on either one of your Home screens or in the app drawer) and tap Uninstall or the trashcan icon.

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . You can either tap the gear app icon to open the app or tap the gear in your Quick Settings panel when you swipe down from the top of your screen.

steps.title: Allow downloading from outside sources.
steps.content: Allow downloading from outside sources. If Security is listed, tap that, and select "Unknown Sources: Allow installation of apps from sources other than the Play Store." Otherwise, tap Apps > â‹® > Special access > Install unknown apps . You can change this setting back after you've installed the old Netflix app.

steps.title: Go to https://netflixhelp.s3.amazonaws.com/netflix-4.16-200217-release.apk in a web browser on your Android.
steps.content: Go to https://netflixhelp.s3.amazonaws.com/netflix-4.16-200217-release.apk in a web browser on your Android. The website will open and close to indicate that the download has started.

steps.title: Tap the downloaded file.
steps.content: Tap the downloaded file. You should get a notification when the download is complete.

steps.title: Tap Install.
steps.content: Tap Install . A window will pop-up when you tap the file asking if you want to install an old file. Once it's done downloading, you'll find the Netflix app on one of your Home screens or in the app drawer. [1] X Research source
